caption.p: Predicted whooping crane population growth during an 11‐year solar cycle for two atmospheric CO 2 concentration scenarios. Top dotted line represents long‐term mean population growth of 3.5%. Points represent mean predictions and vertical bars 95% confidence intervals. Only a solar cycle similar to the Dalton minimum with ≤400 ppm CO 2 will likely maintain population growth at or above the long‐term mean of 3.5%
